trans-unit.source: Exploring the Windows PowerShell ISE
trans-unit.target: Exploring the Windows PowerShell ISE

trans-unit.source: powershell,cmdlet
trans-unit.target: powershell,cmdlet

trans-unit.source: Exploring the Windows PowerShell ISE
trans-unit.target: Exploring the Windows PowerShell ISE

trans-unit.source: You can use the Windows PowerShellÂ® Integrated Scripting Environment (ISE) to create, run, and debug commands and scripts.
trans-unit.target: You can use the Windows PowerShellÂ® Integrated Scripting Environment (ISE) to create, run, and debug commands and scripts.

trans-unit.source: The Windows PowerShell ISE consists of the menu bar, Windows PowerShell tabs, the toolbar, script tabs, a Script Pane, a Console Pane, a status bar, a text-size slider and context-sensitive Help.
trans-unit.target: The Windows PowerShell ISE consists of the menu bar, Windows PowerShell tabs, the toolbar, script tabs, a Script Pane, a Console Pane, a status bar, a text-size slider and context-sensitive Help.

trans-unit.source: Beginning with Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 the Command and Output Panes were combined into a single Console Pane.
trans-unit.target: Beginning with Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 the Command and Output Panes were combined into a single Console Pane.

trans-unit.source: Menu Bar
trans-unit.target: Menu Bar

trans-unit.source: The menu bar contains the **File**, **Edit**, **View**, **Tools**, **Debug**, **Add-ons**, and **Help** menus.
trans-unit.target: The menu bar contains the **File**, **Edit**, **View**, **Tools**, **Debug**, **Add-ons**, and **Help** menus.

trans-unit.source: The buttons on the menus allow you to perform tasks related to writing and running scripts and running commands in the Windows PowerShell ISE.
trans-unit.target: The buttons on the menus allow you to perform tasks related to writing and running scripts and running commands in the Windows PowerShell ISE.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, an [add-on tool](../../core-powershell/ise/The-ISEAddOnTool-Object.md) may be placed on the menu bar by running scripts that use the [Windows PowerShell ISE Scripting Object Model](../../core-powershell/ise/The-Windows-PowerShell-ISE-Scripting-Object-Model.md).
trans-unit.target: Additionally, an [add-on tool](../../core-powershell/ise/The-ISEAddOnTool-Object.md) may be placed on the menu bar by running scripts that use the [Windows PowerShell ISE Scripting Object Model](../../core-powershell/ise/The-Windows-PowerShell-ISE-Scripting-Object-Model.md).

trans-unit.source: In Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0, The **Tools** and **Add-ons** menus were not present.
trans-unit.target: In Windows PowerShell ISE 2.0, The **Tools** and **Add-ons** menus were not present.

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell Tabs
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell Tabs

trans-unit.source: A Windows PowerShell tab is the environment in which a Windows PowerShell script runs.
trans-unit.target: A Windows PowerShell tab is the environment in which a Windows PowerShell script runs.

trans-unit.source: You can open new Windows PowerShell tabs in the Windows PowerShell ISE to create separate environments on your local computer or on remote computers.
trans-unit.target: You can open new Windows PowerShell tabs in the Windows PowerShell ISE to create separate environments on your local computer or on remote computers.

trans-unit.source: You may have a maximum of eight PowerShell tabs simultaneously open.
trans-unit.target: You may have a maximum of eight PowerShell tabs simultaneously open.

trans-unit.source: Toolbar
trans-unit.target: Toolbar

trans-unit.source: The following buttons are located on the toolbar.
trans-unit.target: The following buttons are located on the toolbar.

trans-unit.source: Button
trans-unit.target: Button

trans-unit.source: Function
trans-unit.target: Function

trans-unit.source: **New**
trans-unit.target: **New**

trans-unit.source: Opens a new script.
trans-unit.target: Opens a new script.

trans-unit.source: **Open**
trans-unit.target: **Open**

trans-unit.source: Opens an existing script or file.
trans-unit.target: Opens an existing script or file.

trans-unit.source: **Save**
trans-unit.target: **Save**

trans-unit.source: Saves a script or file.
trans-unit.target: Saves a script or file.

trans-unit.source: **Cut**
trans-unit.target: **Cut**

trans-unit.source: Cuts the selected text and copies it to the clipboard.
trans-unit.target: Cuts the selected text and copies it to the clipboard.

trans-unit.source: **Copy**
trans-unit.target: **Copy**

trans-unit.source: Copies the selected text to the clipboard.
trans-unit.target: Copies the selected text to the clipboard.

trans-unit.source: **Paste**
trans-unit.target: **Paste**

trans-unit.source: Pastes the contents of the clipboard at the cursor location.
trans-unit.target: Pastes the contents of the clipboard at the cursor location.

trans-unit.source: **Clear Output Pane**
trans-unit.target: **Clear Output Pane**

trans-unit.source: Clears all content in the Output Pane.
trans-unit.target: Clears all content in the Output Pane.

trans-unit.source: **Undo**
trans-unit.target: **Undo**

trans-unit.source: Reverses the action that was just performed.
trans-unit.target: Reverses the action that was just performed.

trans-unit.source: **Redo**
trans-unit.target: **Redo**

trans-unit.source: Performs the action that was just undone.
trans-unit.target: Performs the action that was just undone.

trans-unit.source: **Run Script**
trans-unit.target: **Run Script**

trans-unit.source: Runs a script.
trans-unit.target: Runs a script.

trans-unit.source: **Run Selction**
trans-unit.target: **Run Selction**

trans-unit.source: Runs a selected portion of a script.
trans-unit.target: Runs a selected portion of a script.

trans-unit.source: **Stop Execution**
trans-unit.target: **Stop Execution**

trans-unit.source: Stops a script that is running.
trans-unit.target: Stops a script that is running.

trans-unit.source: **New Remote PowerShell Tab**
trans-unit.target: **New Remote PowerShell Tab**

trans-unit.source: Creates a new PowerShell Tab that establishes a session on a remote computer.
trans-unit.target: Creates a new PowerShell Tab that establishes a session on a remote computer.

trans-unit.source: A dialog box appears and prompts you to enter details required to establish the remote connection.
trans-unit.target: A dialog box appears and prompts you to enter details required to establish the remote connection.

trans-unit.source: **Start PowerShell.exe**
trans-unit.target: **Start PowerShell.exe**

trans-unit.source: Opens a PowerShell Console.
trans-unit.target: Opens a PowerShell Console.

trans-unit.source: **Show Script Pane Top**
trans-unit.target: **Show Script Pane Top**

trans-unit.source: Moves the Script Pane to the top in the display.
trans-unit.target: Moves the Script Pane to the top in the display.

trans-unit.source: **Show Script Pane Right**
trans-unit.target: **Show Script Pane Right**

trans-unit.source: Moves the Script Pane to the right in the display.
trans-unit.target: Moves the Script Pane to the right in the display.

trans-unit.source: **Show Script Pane Maximized**
trans-unit.target: **Show Script Pane Maximized**

trans-unit.source: Maximizes the Script Pane.
trans-unit.target: Maximizes the Script Pane.

trans-unit.source: Script Tab
trans-unit.target: Script Tab

trans-unit.source: Displays the name of the script you are editing.
trans-unit.target: Displays the name of the script you are editing.

trans-unit.source: You can click a script tab to select the script you want to edit.
trans-unit.target: You can click a script tab to select the script you want to edit.

trans-unit.source: When you point to the script tab, the fully qualified path to the script file appears in a tooltip.
trans-unit.target: When you point to the script tab, the fully qualified path to the script file appears in a tooltip.

trans-unit.source: Script Pane
trans-unit.target: Script Pane

trans-unit.source: Allows you to create and run scripts.
trans-unit.target: Allows you to create and run scripts.

trans-unit.source: You can open, edit and run existing scripts in the Script Pane.
trans-unit.target: You can open, edit and run existing scripts in the Script Pane.

trans-unit.source: Output Pane
trans-unit.target: Output Pane

trans-unit.source: Displays the results of the commands and scripts you have run.
trans-unit.target: Displays the results of the commands and scripts you have run.

trans-unit.source: You can also copy and clear the contents in the Output Pane.
trans-unit.target: You can also copy and clear the contents in the Output Pane.

trans-unit.source: Command Pane
trans-unit.target: Command Pane

trans-unit.source: Allows you to write commands.
trans-unit.target: Allows you to write commands.

trans-unit.source: You can run a one line command or a multiline command in the Command Pane.
trans-unit.target: You can run a one line command or a multiline command in the Command Pane.

trans-unit.source: Press SHIFT+ENTER to enter each line of a multiline command, and press ENTER after the last line to execute the multiline command.
trans-unit.target: Press SHIFT+ENTER to enter each line of a multiline command, and press ENTER after the last line to execute the multiline command.

trans-unit.source: The prompt displayed on top of the Command Pane shows the path to the current working directory.
trans-unit.target: The prompt displayed on top of the Command Pane shows the path to the current working directory.

trans-unit.source: Status Bar
trans-unit.target: Status Bar

trans-unit.source: Allows you to see whether the commands and scripts that you run are complete.
trans-unit.target: Allows you to see whether the commands and scripts that you run are complete.

trans-unit.source: The status bar is at the very bottom of the display.
trans-unit.target: The status bar is at the very bottom of the display.

trans-unit.source: Selected portions of error messages are displayed on the status bar.
trans-unit.target: Selected portions of error messages are displayed on the status bar.

trans-unit.source: Text-Size Slider
trans-unit.target: Text-Size Slider

trans-unit.source: Increases or decreases the size of the text on the screen.
trans-unit.target: Increases or decreases the size of the text on the screen.

trans-unit.source: Help
trans-unit.target: Help

trans-unit.source: Help for Windows PowerShell ISE is available on the Web in the TechNet Library.
trans-unit.target: Help for Windows PowerShell ISE is available on the Web in the TechNet Library.

trans-unit.source: You can open the Help by clicking **Windows PowerShell ISE Help** on the **Help** menu or by pressing the F1 key anywhere except when the cursor is on a cmdlet name in either the Script Pane or the Console Pane.
trans-unit.target: You can open the Help by clicking **Windows PowerShell ISE Help** on the **Help** menu or by pressing the F1 key anywhere except when the cursor is on a cmdlet name in either the Script Pane or the Console Pane.

trans-unit.source: From the **Help** menu you can also run the Update-Help cmdlet, and display the Command Window which assists you in constructing commands by showing you all of the parameters for a cmdlet and enabling you to fill in the parameters in an easy-to-use form.
trans-unit.target: From the **Help** menu you can also run the Update-Help cmdlet, and display the Command Window which assists you in constructing commands by showing you all of the parameters for a cmdlet and enabling you to fill in the parameters in an easy-to-use form.

trans-unit.source: See Also
trans-unit.target: See Also

trans-unit.source: [Using the Windows PowerShell ISE](../../core-powershell/ise/Using-the-Windows-PowerShell-ISE.md)
trans-unit.target: [Using the Windows PowerShell ISE](../../core-powershell/ise/Using-the-Windows-PowerShell-ISE.md)
